actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a deduction for postsecondary education expenses, to make permanent the exclusion for employer-provided education, and for other purposes.
short_title: Common Sense Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1996

summary.text: Common Sense Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1996 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual a deduction for the amount of qualified higher education expenses paid by the individual. Limits the amount allowed to $10,000. Provides for a limitation based on modified adjusted gross income and other limitations. Makes permanent the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance programs.

titles.title: Common Sense Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1996
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a deduction for postsecondary education expenses, to make permanent the exclusion for employer-provided education, and for other purposes.
